info.title: TON HTTP API C++
info.description:
This API enables HTTP access to TON blockchain - getting accounts and wallets information, looking up blocks and transactions, sending messages to the blockchain, calling get methods of smart contracts, and more.

In addition to REST API, all methods are available through [JSON-RPC endpoint](#json%20rpc)  with `method` equal to method name and `params` passed as a dictionary.

The response contains a JSON object, which always has a boolean field `ok` and either `error` or `result`. If `ok` equals true, the request was successful and the result of the query can be found in the `result` field. In case of an unsuccessful request, `ok` equals false and the error is explained in the `error`.

API Key should be sent either as `api_key` query parameter or `X-API-Key` header

address.name: address
address.description: Identifier of target TON account in any form

afterLtOptional.name: after_lt
afterLtOptional.description: Logical time of transaction to read after

afterAccountHashOptional.name: after_hash
afterAccountHashOptional.description: Hash of account in this block in hex or base64 representation, which indicates transaction to read after

countOptional.name: count
countOptional.description: Maximum number of items in response

limitOptional.name: limit
limitOptional.description: Maximum number of items in response

ltOptional.name: lt
ltOptional.description: Logical time of the transaction to start from

createdLt.name: created_lt
createdLt.description: Creation logical time of a message

value.error: Smart contract is not a Jetton or NFT

AccountStateEnum.description: Computed from code/frozen_hash by the API server.

account.description: Account address in a raw form

MasterchainInfo.description: Information about the latest masterchain block.

after_merge.description: True if block was created after a merge.

after_split.description: True if block was created after a split.

before_split.description: True if block was created before a split.

want_merge.description: Indicates if validators wanted a merge.

want_split.description: Indicates if validators wanted a split.

is_key_block.description: True if this block is a key block.

shards.description: List of outgoing message queue sizes per shard.

ext_msg_queue_size_limit.description: Limit for the external message queue size.

id.description: Identifier of the block containing the transactions

incomplete.description: Indicates if the transaction list is incomplete
